bioghist.p: Victor Bockris (b.1949) is an English-born, U.S.-based author, primarily of biographies of artists, writers, and musicians. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 1971. While in Philadelphia, he founded Telegraph Books. He moved to New York City in 1973 and became an associate of Warhol and Burroughs. He worked for Warhol at the Factory and published many pieces in Warhol's magazine Interview, often in collaboration with Andrew Wylie, now best known as a literary agent. He has written about Lou Reed (and The Velvet Underground), Andy Warhol, Keith Richards, William S. Burroughs, Terry Southern, Blondie, Patti Smith, and Muhammad Ali. He also helped write the autobiographies of John Cale and Bebe Buell.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Victor Bockris. Materials include: correspondence with writers and others, including Kenneth Bluford and Patti Smith; issues of many small poetry zines and publications, mainly from Red Room Books and Angel Hair Books; manuscripts for Finished: A Novel by Bockris; "Electric Generation" columns; and a Patti Smith interview. The collection includes several photographs of Patti Smith.
